p: Malaria is a protozoan infection caused by Plasmodium ( P. falciparum, P. vivax, P. ovale and P. malariae), with P. falciparum being the most dangerous form of the disease due to the related highest rates of complications and mortality. The main vector to humans and other mammals is mosquitoes of the genus Anopheles, which comprises more than 400 species, with only a few epidemiologically important. These mosquitoes have nocturnal habits, and only females feed on blood and are responsible for the transmission of the Plasmodium (Rabinovitch et al. 1998; FioCruz 2017).
